title.narrative: South Sudan Solar energy research project in Juba and Gorgrial.

description.narrative:
CTP and its partners TOCH and ADA with technical support form SELCO are embarking on a energy need assessment in South Sudan and the focus will be in Juba (IDPs Camps) and Gogrial (Kuajok). These locations are chosen based on strong location presence of implementing partners (ADA working in Juba and TOCH working in Gogrial). The assessment will focus on pastoralist, farmers (Crop framers) and small-scale business. The assessment will be conducted using both qualitative and quantitative data collection methods, the qualitative data will be collected through focus group discussions (FGD) and key informant interviews (KII).The quantitative data will be collected using individual profiling selecting people who are actively engaged in pastoralism, farming, and small scale business.
The main gap relating to energy delivery and use in South Sudan is that there are no developmental policies and strategies, and the current policies are still at drafting stage. Therefore, at this level is an opportunity to contribute in shaping the direction of the energy sector in the country, since the finding of this research can be used to make some informed decisions by the government and other development agencies. At the Non-Governmental Organization level, the current focus of most NGOs and UN Agencies including ICRC who have been active in the energy sector, is on delivering humanitarian assistance due to the devastating humanitarian situation in the country, coupled with limited funding opportunities relating to the energy sector. Therefore, the engagement in this research will represent an opportunity to the people of South Sudan who are in their need of renewable energy supply. Through this assessment, an action plan for establishing renewable energy and energy efficient strategies, and a financial mechanism will be developed.
